newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-RBA says current rates stance helps growth.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-RBA says current rates stance helps growth.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) said on Thursday that its current monetary policy stance was helping economic growth.
The central bank said that the current level of rates was accommodating an economic pick-up and there were signs that economic growth was increasing.
The manufacturing sector was, however, the exception to the generally firmer picture.
Inflation was likely to remain low in the near-term, the RBA also said.
"The bank's assessment is that the current level of cash rates is accommodating the pickup in activity without prejudicing continued low inflation," the RBA said.
"While potential wages developments are a source of longer term uncertainty for the inflation outlook, the immediate prospects are that inflation will remain low," it said

"So far in 1997 there have already been some indications that the pace of growth is picking up, particularly in areas of construction investment, housing and consumer spending," the central bank's semi-annual statement on monetary policy said.
